main.java

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Grid Class The Grid class handles the operation used by Main to simulate Conway's Game of Life. The underlying representation is a 2D array of integers which hold 1 or 0 (alive or dead respectively)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int c
      Column variable for the grid dimentions.
      int currentTick
      Tick counter to represent the generation
      int[][] g
      2D array of integers (1 or 0) which represent the status of a cell
      java.lang.String outputFilePattern
      String to hold output filepattern.
      int r
      row variable for the grid dimentions
      int totalTick
      Variable to hold the total amout of iterations for the simulation

        public void setPattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Setter to set the output file pattern (configured via the GUI)
        Parameters:
        pattern - String value of the output file pattern name

      • setTotalTick

        public void setTotalTick(int tickcount)
        Setter for the total iteration count
        Parameters:
        tickcount - int value of the total generations to simulate

      • buildGrid

        public void buildGrid(java.lang.String path)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        path - Full path of the input filename to read from and parse.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error in reading from the file or closing the file.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if a number cannot be parseed from the file.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if there is a problem in the specified path. Ex: The file doesn't exist
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if there are other misc. problems with reading the file. A useful message will be printed to the terminal.

      • nextStep

        public void nextStep()
        Function to generate the state of the grid after one unit of time.

      • updateCell

        public int updateCell(int rw,
                      int cl,
                      int[][] old_grid)
        Function which returns the updated result of a given cell based off the state of the old grid
        Parameters:
        rw - row index to update
        cl - column index to update
        old_grid - the old grid to determine the new status of index rw, cl int the new grid
        Returns:
        0 or 1 depending on if the cell should be alive or dead

      • writeGrid

        public void writeGrid(java.lang.String path,
                      int itr)
        Function to write the grid to the output file specified
        Parameters:
        path - the full path of the output file to write to.
        itr - the iteration of the simulation (how much time has passed)

      • printGrid

        public void printGrid()
        Function to print the grid to the terminal. Will print in a matrix like shape, with dimensions: [this.r x this.c]
